name: Wtb-research-GeoSpatial Analysis with R
body:
# Using R

There are several mirror sites which have varying libraries of packages and versions.  I favor the UCLA site which is also referred to as US2 in the list that appears when you select "Install packages" from the R menu.
Start by downloading the most recent version of R from the [CRAN site](http://cran.stat.ucla.edu/).  Here are the packages you'll need to complete most of the mapping and graphics tasks used in Geo-Spatial analysis of our data.
* Rmap - 
* Rgdal - Rgdal is what allows R to understand the structure of shapefiles by providing functions to read and convert spatial data into easy-to-work-with R dataframes.
* Sp - Sp enables transformations and projections of the data and provides functions for working with the loaded spatial polygon objects.
* Maptools - 
* rgeos - 
* ggplot2 - 
* ggmap -
